title: Meghan Markle Steps Out in a Gorgeous Red Pencil Skirt for a One Young World Event with Prince Harry
text:
From Town & Country

This morning, Meghan Markle stepped out in the perfect fall look to help lead a forum about gender equality. The duchess stunned as she arrived at the One Young World event, wearing a cranberry-colored leather pencil skirt by Hugo Boss, which she paired with a sweater in the same shade, and matching pumps.

View photos Photo credit: WPA Pool - Getty Images More

On Twitter, shoe brand Sarah Flint confirmed that the duchess is wearing their heels, but in a bespoke color.

"They are indeed our Perfect Pump 100mm in a custom colorway for Meghan, Duchess of Sussex," reads the social media post.

Meghan has been involved with One Young World for several years, since even before she started dating Prince Harry. In 2019, the organization partnered with the Queen's Commonweath Trust, of which Meghan is the Vice President. "This was the most exciting collaboration between two groups The Duchess is passionate about and has been working with for some time," reads an Instagram post from the Sussexes about today's event.

Prince Harry's participation in the discussion this morning came as a surprise, but Meghan began the event by saying that men need to be involved in conversations about gender equality.

"I think that conversation can't happen without men being a part of it...You can't have a conversation about women's empowerment with just women," she said before joking, "Thank you for letting him crash the party."

View photos Photo credit: WPA Pool - Getty Images More

Today marks the couple's first public outing together since the documentary Harry & Meghan: An African Journey aired. The program featured candid interviews with both royals, in which they shared their struggles with the media.

In perhaps the most moving clip from the film, Meghan opened up about how the past year has been "really challenging," saying:

"Look any woman especially when they're pregnant, you're really vulnerable, and so that was made really challenging, and then when you have a newborn ... And especially as a woman, it's really, it's a lot. So, you add this on top of just trying to be a new mom or trying to be a newlywed. And also thank you for asking because not many people have asked if I'm okay, but it's a very real thing to be going through behind the scenes."

When Bradby more pointedly asks her if it has been a struggle, the duchess simply says "yes."
